input: Coordinate a patient's procedure by checking OR availability, resolving scheduling conflicts, updating the medical record and billing system, and confirming the final appointment.

inputs.name: P
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

inputs.name: P
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

inputs.name: P
inputs.input_data: Patient's historical and current appointment schedule

inputs.name: P
inputs.input_data: Phone number, email address for notifications

inputs.name: F
inputs.source_origin: Computed from OR Scheduling Data and Existing Appointments

outputs: System update confirming procedure details and scheduled time
Charge entry with procedure code and insurance pre-authorization
SMS/email sent to patient with final details
Updated operating room calendar with new booking
steps:
Uses: OR Scheduling Data (Input 3)  
Action: Query OR Scheduling API for available time slots matching procedure duration  
Produces: Available OR Time Slots  
Stores/Sends To: Temporary processing memory

Uses: Patient's Existing Appointments (Input 4)  
Action: Retrieve patient's current appointments from Medical Records System  
Produces: Appointment Conflict Baseline
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:
1. Patient ID  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: User (scheduling staff)  
   Input Data: Unique identifier for the patient  
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

2. Procedure Details  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: User (clinical team)  
   Input Data: Procedure type, duration, required resources  
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

3. OR Scheduling Data  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Hospital OR Scheduling API  
   Input Data: Real-time operating room availability calendar  
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP]  

4. Patient's Existing Appointments  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Medical Records System API  
   Input Data: Patient's historical and current appointment schedule  
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP]  

5. Patient Insurance Information  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Insurance Verification System API  
   Input Data: Coverage details, pre-authorization status  
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP]  

6. Patient Contact Information  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Medical Records System API  
   Input Data: Phone number, email address for notifications  
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP]  

7. Final Appointment Time  
   Source Type: DERIVABLE  
   Source Origin: Computed from OR Scheduling Data and Existing Appointments  
   Input Data: Scheduled date/time for the procedure  
   Bound Reference: Depends on Inputs 3 and 4  
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]  

Outputs:  
1. Updated Medical Record  
   - System update confirming procedure details and scheduled time  

2. Billing System Update  
   - Charge entry with procedure code and insurance pre-authorization  

3. Appointment Confirmation Notification  
   - SMS/email sent to patient with final details  

4. Resolved OR Schedule  
   - Updated operating room calendar with new booking  

Steps:  
Step 1:  
Uses: OR Scheduling Data (Input 3)  
Action: Query OR Scheduling API for available time slots matching procedure duration  
Produces: Available OR Time Slots  
Stores/Sends To: Temporary processing memory  

Step 2:  
Uses: Patient's Existing Appointments (Input 4)  
Action: Retrieve patient's current appointments from Medical Records System  
Produces: Appointment Conflict Baseline

aeb_analysis.aeb_analysis_raw:
Step: 1  
Is AEB: Yes  
Reason: The step involves a single intent (querying for time slots), interacts with one system boundary (OR Scheduling API), and requires no branching, sequencing, or validation. It can be implemented as a single API call.  

Step: 2  
Is AEB: Yes  
Reason: The step has a single intent (retrieving appointments), interacts with one system boundary (Medical Records System), and contains no branching, sequencing, or validation. It can be implemented as a single API call.
